--- title: Untarify keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Untarify provides the `untar()` method to untar zipped json files. An additional decorator `@powerup_untar`is provided which endows multiprocessign superpowers to the humble unzipping processes." description: "Untarify provides the `untar()` method to untar zipped json files. An additional decorator `@powerup_untar`is provided which endows multiprocessign superpowers to the humble unzipping processes." ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %} {% raw %}

powerup_untar[source]

powerup_untar(func)

Desc: Decorator which endows untar() with superpowers. Divides the untar process to multiple cores Args: Function to be decorated. Returns: Superpowers

{% endraw %} {% raw %}

untar[source]

untar(source:Path, verbose=False)

Desc: creates a file with the same extension as the file contained within the zipped archive and then writes the contents from the zipped file into the new file created Args: source - Path object for the source from where the files needs to be fetched verbose - Let the method know if you want to see progress messages Returns: Path object for the uncompressed file

powerup_untar[source]

powerup_untar(func)

Desc: Decorator which endows untar() with superpowers. Divides the untar process to multiple cores Args: Function to be decorated. Returns: Superpowers

{% endraw %}

Example

The below is an example of using the untar() method

{% raw %} 
path = Path("./test/input/test")
outputPath = Path("./test/working")
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
files = [file for file in path.iterdir() if file.suffix == '.gz']
files

[PosixPath('test/input/test/coronavirus-tweet-id-2020-01-21-22.jsonl.gz'),
 PosixPath('test/input/test/coronavirus-tweet-id-2020-01-21-23.jsonl.gz')]
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
import shutil
test_files = files[:3]
test_target = [outputPath/test_file.stem for test_file in test_files]
for i in range(len(test_files)):
    shutil.copy(str(test_files[i]),str(outputPath/test_files[i].name))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
for file in files:
    untar(file)
{% endraw %}

Example

use untar() to power up the untaring processes. This uses multiple processers.

{% raw %} 
@powerup_untar
def find_source(outputPath, source):
    test_source = [outputPath/source.name for source in source]
    return test_source
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
find_source(outputPath, test_files)
{% endraw %}
